Great Game, truly deserves the title of a "revolutionair" but a bit too many options ingame such as filtering or always run can't be disabled.
Also the German version is ridicolously cut, that wasn't necessary.
Half-Life: Once beat, you can't help but feel as if you're supposed to play it again.

This is one among one of the best games I have ever had the pleasure of playing. Baring in mind the graphics are very dated by todays standards, they were breakthrough at the time this game was released. I started playing this game in 2013 and was hooked from the word go. It just goes to show that even 15 years later, this game blew me away with its charm, storytelling, plot, and fantastic gameplay. I have never played anything like it before. An absolute pleasure from start to finish, with diverse and challenging levels, intelligent AI, interesting dynamic world that really felt alive, I had a lot of fun playing through this. Simply put, one of the greatest titles to have ever been released.

Half life is one of the greatest games i have ever played. Really fun gameplay and cool story, Every time i play i feel like i am really in the game, fighting the monsters and solving weird puzzles. Now do yourself a favor and by this game

For me personally, this is in my top five games. Half life 2 and the episodes are good as well, but this game is one of the best Valve games I've played! I really don't care about how good graphics are, or if the gameplay's realistic or not, all I care about is if the game is fun and if the storyline is epic. This game mastered both of those, and I suggest anyone who wants fun and epicness to play this game!

第一次接触是在玩cs时.
那个时候的cs还是作为HL的mod被集合在游戏中的,只要不是被改的乱七八糟的特别版什么的,都可以玩HL还有DM等mod.
因为一次偶然,才有幸邂逅了这么一款里程碑似的游戏.

我最早玩的,可以被称之为FPS的是DOOM,虽然刺激感和临场感是前所未有的强,但不管玩多长时间,永远都是一个主题:杀!杀!杀!
为了什么?不知道...同伴?没见过...最终目标?或许是杀光敌人吧...
不管哪一关,迎接主角的只有怪兽的利爪或者咆哮的飞弹而已.玩家只是在不同场景中干着同样的事——打怪,捡补给,找钥匙,死...而只有当得到了新武器的时候,那种想一睹其风采的心情,才称的上是唯一的乐趣.
因此比起把时间花在无意义的行为上,倒不如接触一些新类型的游戏要来得好.而网络对战这种与天斗与地斗与人斗其乐无穷的新鲜事物,才总算为无脑突突突类的游戏指明了一条生路.

如果没有HL,那么单机FPS的时代或许会被一笔带过,直接进入联机时代吧.
HL真的将单机FPS的真正的正确的模式带给了每一位玩家.它的诞生使人们明白了,一个10小时的fps游戏需要的不是增加怪的数量,也不是把钥匙藏的极其隐蔽,更不是把关卡数量设置到无限多.而只是很简单的想一个可以让人津津乐道的理由,告诉玩家一个不尽相同的目标就可以了.其实保护安保人员开门,搜集炸药炸开门的结果是一样的,但对于玩家来说,这就是不同,这就是乐趣.

我们可以把HL比喻成是一个相辅相成的巨大机器.
比如它没有了关卡似的设计,取而代之的是一鼓作气的痛快感,事件接踵而至,你觉得完成了一个任务,但那只不过是另一个麻烦的开始,当玩家真正感到舒了一口气的时候,相信只能是最后被迫与G-man进行交易的时候.
若想吸引玩家继续进行下一步,则需要剧情的支持.就好像电视剧那样,始终都要有个吊人胃口的要素存在,不管是戈登几次重返地表又被轰回了地下,还是必须要在三波势力之间周旋,戈登的一举一动都牵动着玩家的神经,可以说戈登的存在本身已经成为了游戏的魅力所在了.更何况还有一个G-man的存在,对于HL来说,只要有这两个人,就有讲不完的故事.
HL的成功还有一个离不开的要素,与剧情遥相呼应的场景.没有选择地球上任何一个已知区域(比如什么观光胜地之类的),也没有一上来就选择外星空间,而是在一个秘密的研究所,在这里,各个部门的设计师们可以大展身手,随意创造各种现代与近未来融合的场景,不管出现什么样的情况,只要场景没离开研究所,那么故事永远都可以自圆其说.

即使在HL发售至今已经16年的今天,HL也依然是一款能够让人一鼓作气通关的游戏.它的游戏性早已不受画面,引擎,操作的制约,也因此才会被称之为里程碑.伟大的里程碑.

Half Life est un FPS avec une histoire accrochante.

-Gameplay : Réactif mais avec aussi des phases de puzzle pour pouvoir avancer dans le jeu et battre les boss.

-Scénario : Cohérent, beaucoup de flou mais pour cela il faut jouer aux opus suivants pour en savoir plus sur l'histoire de Gordon Freeman !

-Durée de vie : Bonne durée de vie, un bon niveau de difficulté la rend encore plus grande.

-Graphismes : C'est un jeu des années 90 certes mais les graphismes n'ont quasiment pas vieillit, ils n'attaquent pas la rétine.

En bref, un excellent FPS que je vous recommande car il est considéré comme l'un des plus grands FPS. (Il a notamment donné naissance à Counter Strike et à Team Fortress)

If you can manage to get this game on sale, I say, go for it! If you look past the limited capabilities of the physics engine, and some of the graphical errors, it really is a great game to play!

Half-Life es un videojuego de disparos en primera persona del género ciencia ficción desarrollado por Valve Corporation, siendo este el juego debut de la compañía y el primero de lo que posteriormente pasaría a ser la serie Half-Life. El título, distribuido por Sierra Studios, fue lanzado el 19 de noviembre de 1998, el juego además fue lanzado para PlayStation 2 el 14 de noviembre de 2002. La trama de Half-Life tiene lugar en una época relativamente actual, pero desconocida.

El juego se basa en un grave accidente que ocurre en Black Mesa Research Facility, Nuevo México, un centro de investigación avanzada del gobierno de los Estados Unidos (Basado en el areá 51 en la vida real).

El protagonista es un científico de 27 años llamado Gordon Freeman, especializado en física teórica por el Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT) quien debe realizar un experimento con una muestra de gran pureza de un mineral desconocido extraterrestre, en el espectrómetro de antimasa del Sector C (Materiales Anómalos) de los laboratorios de Black Mesa. Fuente: Wikipedia

La verdad les digo que este es el mejor juego del mundo, nunca te vas a cansar de jugarlo.

Story:
[spoiler] You are gordon Freeman. An theoretical physic that comes to Black Mesa research facility. You are coming to experiment (Anti-Mass Spectrometer). But resonance cascade will happen. So a lot of xen aliens start teleport from Xen to Earth. And Xen aliens aren't only one that want to kill you. Army is also sent to Black Mesa to kill any survivors of resonance cascade. Can you save the Earth? You need to kill a monster called Nihilanth. [/spoiler]

This is easily one of the greatest FPS games I have ever played.Even today,the game is better than some modern day shooters we play today.Yes,the graphics and sound are a little bit dated,but the gameplay and basically everything else makes up for it.You are Gordon Freeman.Equipped with several weapons and a sweet suit,you have to try to survive attacks from both aliens and the military.Gameplay is pretty straightforward for the most part.You need to make it through chapter after chapter while also killing some enemies every once in a while.But the amazing part about it is that the game isn't all that linear.You just have to find out things on your own,and the solutions always come to you eventually.Along with shooting,there are some puzzles you need to solve to progress,so it's not always just shooting and murdering stuff.The story is excellently told.There's no cutscenes.You just play through it all and experience it.I recommend this game to people who don't even like FPS games.Trust me when I say,you will adore this masterpiece of a game.One of Valve's many gems.
Marco un antes y un despues en el mundo de ls videojuegos.

Half-Life, great games, great stories to tell, and Half-Life 1 is no exception.

I will start with the pros, and end with the cons.

Pros:

+ For people who care about graphics, this game actully looks better then any game released in 1998, it contains nice textures/materials, good models, and awesome map design, there are gibs, but if you don't like gibs you sadly can't turn it off from my knowledge, there probaly is an console command out there which can help you.

+ The gameplay, is great for an singleplayer FPS, shooting at all sorts of aliens, and swinging your crowbar into a box, or a window, or a scientist.

+ Storage space, according to Steam, HL1 is 556 MB, not a lot, and can be downloaded in seconds with decent internet.

+ Specifications, this game can be run by 99% of the computers that are made after 1998.

+ Loading times, Most loading times are very quick, i own an HDD so it takes about 2 seconds to load max, but i think that if you have an SSD, that it will be loaded incredibly quickly.

+ Amazing soundtrack, they fit the game well.

+ There is a training mode, which is rare in recent games.

+ Auto-Save

+ Multiplayer, There is multiplayer for HL1, well, not like sven-coop where you can play the whole HL1 story with other people, but some deathmatch maps that are quite fun.

+ Easter eggs.

+ Great voice acting.

Cons:

- When you first play it, the game feels like a maze, as nobody tells you where to go, you just have to figure everything out yourself.

- You don't feel like saving Scientists or Guards, as they treat you like some peasent in the beginning, it makes you feel disconnected to the game world.

- You can't select a chapter as there is no system to start at a chapter , you have to manually open the console and put in the "Map" command.

- Lack of graphics settings, i know this game is from 1998, but atleast add an option to change Gibs, AA, etc.

- Akward death animations, when an enemy dies, it just flops to the ground, this is because the game doesn't have real physics, only for the minor things.

You are Gordon Freeman. A scientist who works for the Black Mesa facility. And an experiment you took part in has gone completely awry, unleashing an extraterestrial invasion, and now all hell has broken loose in Black Mesa. Your main goal is to survive and to stop the invasion, using the help of surviving Black Mesa employees, whatever you can get your hands on and your own bare wits.

Even if it is over a decade old, Half Life has aged very, very well. In fact it seems to do some things better than most Modern shooters - you can hold a heck of a lot of weapons for example, a great feature that barely has any presence in shooters nowadays. The gunplay is intense but fair, and you have a huge multitude of weapons to utilise - and they are all great and feel powerful. Enemy types are plentiful, varied and can get pretty darn tough as the game progresses. The enemy AI itself is intelligent and fierce - especially the soldiers who know how to flank well and work together. There are friendly NPC's as well, which are actually helpful: Security guards can help deliver covering fire and scientists can unlock doors and heal you if you are low on health. The game also takes good advantage of the environmental elements around it, technically making almost everything a threat or obstacle - some bridges can be destroyed which may require you to find another way around it, wet floors are obviously slippy so you need to be careful not to slide into an elevator shaft - Did I also mention that elevators in this game are barely ever safe? All of these great uses of particular stage elements called for some fantastically designed levels and puzzles that require a skilled gamer to complete.

Graphically, I will admit the game does look a bit blocky by today's standards and the character animations are pretty wooden, but each level within Half Life looks worlds apart from one another, especially the last part of the game, trust me, it's amazing, that's all I'm saying about it, I'm not gonna spoil it. The character and enemy designs themselves, most notably the aliens, are really creative, unique and varied. The real time cutscenes were cutting edge back in the day and even though the choppy and kinda unexistant character animations during these cutscenes are now dated in a sense, the fact that they are REAL TIME just makes them very immersive and makes you feel part of a great story.

When it comes to audio, the soundeffects are great and fits Half Life's sci-fi tone, and the guns are LOUD. The music tracks, although few and far between, are fantastic and give off great atmosphere. The voiceacting is also great, even if the recordings are a bit grainy.

If there was anything I thought that did detract from the overall quality from the game, is the fact that sometimes the player can get glitched in certain parts of the environment, so they can't move, therefore they would need to restart from the last save... but then again this barely ever happens.

Tl;dr Half Life is a groundbreaking FPS that has stood the test of time and I still consider it as one of the best shooters ever made, if not the best. An immersive, action packed, incredibly varied FPS that makes you feel like an action hero. Highly recommended to anyone who has at least an interest in videogames.

I would recommend Half Life as a key piece of gaming history, as it really was ambitious and influential. Unfortunately, it has aged worse than other 90s FPSs. It can be buggy, hit detection is very inconsistent, and there is a strange focus on platforming that just doesn't suit the slippery run-and-gun movement controls. It was ahead of it's time with storytelling and immersion, but  the actual gameplay mechanics don't seem to work well. Fans of Half Life 2 may be disappointed with HL1, moreso because of all the nostalgic praise it gets.
The first Valve game I ever played, and my personal favorite. Buy this game and you will see why.
